page.title: 04LIVINGSTON NEW TOWN
page.content: {Livingston}is Scotland's fourth new town. It has a population of{40,000 approximately. It has an area of 11 square miles.{Livingston}is about 15 miles from Edinburgh and 30 from Glasgow. It was planned in 1965 when it was a farming village and was built because of overcrowding in Glasgow. Today in Livingston there are over 200 industrial companies producing a wide horizon of articles. There is a {station}at{Livingston South}and also another one planned. It has a shopping centre and a hospital under construction. Also it is linked by the M8 Motorway and is close to Edinburgh Airport. Livingston should have a future population of{70,000. }
